name: Hotel Vitale, a Joie de Vivre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I came here to celebrate our anniversary. We used to live in SF so we were picky about location. We loved staying across the from the Ferry building because it was so beautiful and peaceful (especially when comparing it with hotels near Union Square or Fisherman's Wharf). We were able to walk to great restaurants, spend time on the roof deck gazing at the Bay Bridge and could quickly get to public transportation. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very clean. We had an ocean view and the they gave us a complimentary bottle of wine.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my partner at this hotel for one night in a suite.
reviews.title: Bad experience - computer stolen I believe

reviews.text: When we arrived the check in staff was surly and seemed to be indifferent to our requests. They did provide an upgrade to a suite with a modest increase in price.
reviews.title: nice hotel, may be more of a buisness hotel

reviews.text: Here is my problem: I left a computer in the room. A laptop. I haven't seen it since. I called and asked for help and was forwarded to a service manager's line. I talked with him and the hotel manager over the next few days but it was like pulling teeth to get them to look into the room, ask the staff and to take an interest generally. The manager just said their staff were trustworthy, with them for a long time, etc.
reviews.title: Meh

reviews.text: Losing a computer is a very big deal! It is far more compromising than losing your wallet. Nevertheless the hotel management seemed to take a very indifferent approach. I haven't decided what to do next but I will at least start with this review.
reviews.title: Nice,but there's something missing that I just can't put my finger on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Vitale with one day of business across the bay, then two days of fun in SF, my favorite destination. This hotel is perfectly situated for fun and business, just across from the ferry building at the end of Market Street. Every thing we did was in walking distance or a short ride on cable cars, trains, or the ferry.
reviews.title: Great staff, wonderful view, in the perfect location in San Francisco.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff had a reserved but can do approach whenever we needed anything at all. Rooms were very nice with a killer view of the bay. We will return to Vitale when in SF again.
reviews.title: Great return stay. Fabulous Location!

reviews.text: We quite enjoyed our second visit to the Vitale. Wonderful location across from the Ferry Building and walking distance to many great restaurants. Great customer service and we enjoyed the morning yoga as well. Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: A perfect home away from home

reviews.text: I've been down to San Francisco on business quite a few times lately and this is the hotel I always try to book. It's got a trendy elegance to it and an unpretentious and relaxed atmosphere that makes it feel like home.
reviews.title: You Will Like It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable, the service is courteous and polished and the location is fantastic (across the street from the Ferry Building Marketplace).
reviews.title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel - cannot recommend it enough

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the hotel on a Friday night with 3 of my girlfriends to celebrate a birhday.
reviews.title: Great "Girls" escape...
Enamoured on the Embarcadero
reviews.text: From the time I made the reservation to check out I have no complaints.
The hotel staff was more then gracious to us. The Valet gentelmen opened doors for us and assisted us in getting out of the car.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel!!
For th £££ spent, I'd expect better
reviews.text: The Bellwoman was awesome. She was so friendly and happy to assist us.

reviews.title: Location, location!
reviews.text: After getting settled we were heading to the bar and were greeted in the hall by the concierge who had a birthday card for the birthday girl. And, upon our return we were pleased to find extra robes, towels and a complimentary bottle of champagne.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is WOW WOW WOW!!!!!!! I booked a circular suite (7th floor - the highest one available) because of a) a king bed, b) the view and c) the soaking tub. The hotel is extremely calm and peaceful, and it smells good everywhere you go. What really sets it apart, though, is the service. My husband and I are here celebrating our anniversary. I mentioned this when booking the room. We arrived 3 hours before check in, and the woman at the front desk was extremely friendly and polite. As it turned out, our room was ready (we were expecting to have to store our luggage). The view of the bay bridge is absolutely incredible. Around 10 minutes after we got into our room, (the luggage was brought up immediately following), a bellhop arrived with a bottle of sparkling wine, glasses, a plate with strawberries, grapes, dates, a fresh apricot and apple and a card that said how much the hotel appreciated our staying there. We (of course!) drank and ate, and then wandered out to the ferry building and down the Embarcadero. We returned a few hours later to find a vase filled with fresh flowers, roses and stargazer lilies (I think...I'm no flower expert but they smell really good) and a handwritten hallmark card wishing us a happy anniversary and signed from the housekeeping staff. We felt incredibly well taken care of and are so impressed at how far everyone went out of their way to make us feel special. As all of the previous reviews have stated, the bath products smell better than anything, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The automatic shades are awesome too - the sun would have woken us waaaay to early if not for those. One last note - we do not regularly spend $700. on a hotel room - this was a splurge for our anniversary. We will be returning to SF after a conference and staying at thbe 4 Seasons (also a splurge for us). I have doubts that they could ever beat our experience here....but we'll see! By the way....I'm writing this from the hotel as we wait for our massage appointments at 11 am.
reviews.title: Simply Awesome!!!!!

likes.disliked: — you can hear the cars on the street outside, but that's to be expected given the location

reviews.title: Mostly Great
reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times so far this year for business. Overall I'm extremely pleased with this hotel. The valet and front desk folks are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms (standard) are very comfortable with nice bedding, very clean bathrooms and a nice layout. I very much appreciate the free in-room internet access. I should know how the gym is, but I'm apparently too lazy to walk down the hall.

reviews.title: Great Location and Views, but......
reviews.text: Couple of places for improvement:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.) The wait for room service can sometimes be 45 minutes or more. Even on weeknights. Even for just a salad and a dessert.
reviews.title: Great stay during our honeymoon
Best Hotel in S.F.
reviews.text: 2.) The towels in the bathroom are awful. Very thin and very scratchy. I can never understand why I can get towels at Target for cheap that are 10x better and hotels rarely have soft towels. At $200+ per night I expect nice towels.

I have stayed at Hotel Vitale twice, and both stays were excellent! First, the facility is top notch - very comfortable, clean and modern rooms with some very nice amenities, e.g. LCD TV, Fresh bath products, rain shower, etc. Second, the location is unbeatable. It is right across from the Ferry Building, which is a foodie's haven, has a neat farmer's market on certain days, is close to BART, and provides easy access to the ferries The views from the waterfront rooms are stunning, and the neighborhood is very quiet at night, unlike Union Square. Third, room services and the restaurant, Americano, are also excellent. Like another reviewer, I found the room service to be very consistent and quick. Dinner at Americano was excellent, and the day and turn down services were great. With so many great qualities, it's no surprise that I proposed to my fiance at the hotel :).
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel!

reviews.text: After a three night stay at the Hotel Vitale, I have to say I left disappointed. For the prices charged ($300+ for waterview), I expected better. First the good; the facilities are great and the location is unbeatable. The room features a great bed, comfortable seating, a plasma TV, and a beautiful and large bathroom. Our view looked out on the water (while looking over the Embarcadero) and the Ferry Building (now converted into a foodie heaven!). The lobby is beautiful in an "ultracool" sort of way. My complaints lie with the staff. While housekeeping and the man who brought extra pillows were exceedingly nice, everyone from the doormen, front desk clerks, concierge, valets, and bell hops seemed to be either too busy or too cool to be helpful. A word of advice to the doormen, if you don't want to open doors even for pregnant women with arms full of packages, perhaps you should look for a different line of work. Further to the valets, forty five minutes to retrieve a car is unacceptable. If you're looking for a place to see and be seen, perhaps this is the place for you. However, if you expect staff eager to help and a relaxing place to stay, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Overpriced for what it is

reviews.text: Perfect Location & Lovely Environment --- Two minute walk to Embarcadero/Financial District. Lovely boutique hotel with great public interiors and VERY comfortable rooms. Beds and linens are top-notch and will provide one of your best sleeps in the USA. Lovely interior finishes, with high end art work and furniture. The staff bends over backwards (regardless of the hour) to help you with restaurant reservations, billing receipts, and other necessities. Room service is consistently presented within 20 minutes or less, regardless of the time of day. The staff is responsive, and willing to help you regardless of the request. I have been attending business sessions in SF for over two decades, and have never stayed in a hotel more accomodating in terms of comfort or amenities. The price is comparable (or less) than the typical competition in the neighborhood, and yet I felt more comfortable and ''pampered'' here than in the other neighborhood 5 star hotels. Will definitely make this my base of stay from now on.
reviews.title: Cool Little Find
Best Hotel!
reviews.text: I travel 100% for work and stay in many hotels. The Hotel Vitale is one of the best hotels I have stayed in during my travels. It is stylish, clean, large, friendly and comfortable. I highly recommend!

reviews.title: Hotel Vitale, a perfect 10
reviews.text: My wife andI recently stayed at Hotel Vitale. We did an exahustive online search as well as asking for recommendations from family and friends that live in the area. The one name that kept comng up was Hotel Vitale. The hotel has an outstanding location-just blocks from where you want to be for shopping, dining and night life but far enough away from the crowds and commotion. We reserved a room facing the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was extremely comfortable and pristine. The bed, pillows and blankets made for great sleeping conditions-plush and luxurious. The overall room decor was calm and soothing. Arriving back to the flawlessly cleaned room each evening with the music playing softly, the bed turned down helped us wind down after a hectic day. The difference between a good hotel and a great one is in the details. The Hotel Vitale is a great hotel. As I mentioned, the room was spotless. The climate controls were silent and worked perfectly. A paper of my choosing was waiting outside my door each morning. Even the common areas-lobby, hallways and ground floor restrooms were well maintained and immaculate. Yes, little things but these little things add to the overall experience.

I've never stayed in the same San Francisco hotel twice (I've stayed in over a dozen different hotels at this point), but I do plan to return to the Vitale. While other hotels in San Francisco boast more luxuries, the Vitale has a good price to amenities ratio. It's modern with free WiFi that actually works; the location is excellent, and the views are stunning. I had a large enough corner room with a delightful view of the Ferry Building and the Bay Bridge.
reviews.title: Room with a View

likes.liked: — lovely views, great value, cool decor
likes.disliked: — lousy breakfast, no bathtub, sugar lemon bath products

reviews.title: discrimination
reviews.text: A few things worth mentioning if you are considering staying here: many rooms, even the more expensive ones (I had a waterfront room at over $400/night) do NOT have bathtubs. The room service breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and the Fresh bathroom products (sugar lemon) left me feeling like I'd been working too long at a children's lemonade stand. The staff are very nice, although they don't always get things that count right (check in and out has it's glitches). Also unless you are interested in a pick up scene, the downstairs bar is not for you. That being said, the mini bar is excellent and with the sofa and view from my room, as well as the private terraces for guests, there are plenty of places for that quite beverage with a view.

The mistreatment of the prolific professor Ngugi Wa Thiong'o at Hotel Vitale in San Francisco, California. This incident occurred on November 10, 2006. The hotel worker in question still works at Vitale, where he continues his racist behaviors towards Black guests under the support of Hotel managers.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: By Ngugi Wa Thiong'o
reviews.title: Hip Comfort in the heart of the Embarcadero

likes.liked: — It's location in the Embarcadero. I felt like I was just minutes away from anything in the city.
likes.disliked: — That breakfast was not served after 10:30AM. Not everyone is an early riser, and it is after all the most important meal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked into Hotel Vitale on Thursday, 9th November in room 640.
reviews.title: Nice, but I don't know about 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This way my first visit to this hotel, and certainly won't be my last. I booked it based primarily on what a friend described as her "favorite place to stay in SF," which pretty much describes it for me too.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel in SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Vitale really is a cut above. The rooms are beautifully furnished, and ours had a spectacular view of the Bay Bridge and Ferry Building. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Often you might expect the staff at high-end "chic" hotels to be snooty or elitist- the staff here could not have been more helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Believe the reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms are a real treat- waterfall showers, glass walled shower, clean and attractive. However, there is little privacy to be had- the bathroom has an industrial-style sliding door (not a pocket door) with 2" gaps on either side between the wall and door. Anyone passing by the bathroom will be able to see you in the shower!
reviews.title: Left My Heart In San Francisco

likes.disliked: — No room in the bar during the evenings

reviews.title: Book the Hotel Vitale it is worth it
reviews.text: Skip the Americano restaurant unless you're visiting for drinks during the very popular after-work social hours. The menu is very pricey, and while the food is good the restaurant does not live up to its cost. The upholstery was in surprisingly bad shape and the wait staff was so-so.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to any San Francisco visitors. Be aware that it is a 20-30 minute walk to the touristy Union Square and Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf areas. The location, however, is adjacent to the financial district and the recently renovated Ferry Building with its many celebrated restaurants.
reviews.title: Awesome place

likes.disliked: — The bar, which is great but to busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights and the Hotel is excellent. Good standard of rooms and nice and quiet. Good lcoation just approx 10 mins walk to Fishermans Wharf and 15 mins walk to main shopping malls. Keith the Concierge was very helpful with recommendations and advice.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I've stayed at Hotel Vitale twice in the past few months, for business purposes. I find the staff to be friendly, knowledgeable and invested in their work at the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, have beautiful views with all the modern comforts and free wi-fi, which is always nice for a business traveler. I expected a bit of noise when I stayed on the 2nd floor during my second stay but was surprised, even though the bar was bustling, to find the room was quiet. I will stay here every time I travel to San Francisco for work!
reviews.title: Seamless service

reviews.text: stayed 4 days there with my 10 yr twins and wife. the hotel location is great, the decor and colour schemes are elegant and trendy. overall we had a very pleasant stay and thought the front line staff was superb, friendly and professional. shame that room service and car valetting are not to the same standards.
reviews.title: great location, charming decor, great front line service, other services should do better

reviews.text: otherwise the room was ok but its layout not perfect. for instance there is very little cupboard space.
reviews.title: Perfect from beginning to end!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a great rate at this hotel on Hotwire, but after just one night here, I would definitely pay full price. The room was nice and large and comfortable and very clean. The service was impeccable. Every employee was friendly and helpful. The location to The Ferry Building is the best.
reviews.title: Wow! Forget Fisherman's Wharf - You will want to stay here!

reviews.text: While I am a resdent of San Francisco, my company's local office frequently hosts events for associates from around the world. We recently hosted one such event and I was put up in the hotel--to my wife's changrin. It was a nice stay. The room was great, the atmosphere was wonderful and the location superb. My only complaint is the service in the restaurant. At the end of each day, everyone would meet downstairs for a couple of cocktails before going out to eat. For an entire week, we all had the worst bar service...ever. Slow, unresponsive with a lackluster approach to customer service that borders on maligned. I find it astounding that Hotel Vitale is unable/unaware to rectify this problem. Waiting for service while the bartenders talk it up with each other and the general waitstaff at the expense of paying customers is just wrong--every day for 6 days straight is astounding really.
reviews.title: Hotel = Wonderful; Bartenders = the worst...ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WMH
reviews.title: Fantastic in many ways

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Francisco
reviews.title: Wish I could move in!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Vitale is amazing for many reasons. It has about as perfect a location as you could desire as it is super close to almost all the public transport in SF and is right on the Embarcadero. Its location directly across from the Ferry Building is a huge bonus for people who love delicious restaurants and beautiful food-related shops.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I picked this hotel based on the reviews here... I booked a city view room and was given a courtyard view room instead... We were only staying for 2 nights so it really didn't matter too much... but I just thought the hotel was a over lauded here on tripadvisor... the location is nice, as it is right across the street form the Ferry Building and the general neighbourhood is very chill and nice but the hotel is just average. The staff was courteous and professional but there is really nothing to write home about this hotel.
reviews.title: Meh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights after flying from London. It is a modern boutique hotel with very comfortable rooms and friendly and helpful staff. They did not blink when we arrived with rucksacks. It provided everything we wanted for a place to crash for a couple of nights. The food in the dining room was good and they were very happy for us to have a small amount not at a normal meal time. The bar area is humming in the evening but it didn't bother us at all. The location is excellent. Would recommend it and definitely stay again if we could.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Recovering from Jet Lag!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll keep this short and sweet..!
reviews.title: Amazing, amazing, amazing!!!

reviews.text: The best hotel I have ever stayed in. Service, rooms, location, food, everything outstanding, I cannot recommend this hotel enough! 5***** 20 out of 10 !!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel for a visit

reviews.text: View of the bay bridge is breathtaking,
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but not take customers a bit for granted - its success may work against it

reviews.text: I loved Hotel Vitale! I went on a much needed mom-of-3-kids get-away by myself, and I picked a great place to spend 24 hours. The service was excellent, the room was beautiful and clean...the linens to die for!...the restaurant was fantastic! I have zero complaints. I did the bath on the rooftop under the stars...what a treat! Went for a run along the waterfront, shopped at Union Square...had a great weekend. I will definitely return to Hotel Vitale next time I need some R&R.
reviews.title: Will definitely return!

reviews.text: I'd stayed at the Vitale on four previous business trips and had pleasant experiences marred only by the pretentious indifference of some staff members. Someone clearly is doing something right, because this visit (a combination of business and pleasure) was exceptional in every way. The young folks behind the reception desk were warm and welcoming. The concierge, Keith, was extremely helpful. The service in the hotel's restaurant was swift and solicitious, and the food (we had only breakfasts) was first-rate. Our well-appointed room was scrupulously clean,. My wife enjoyed an excellent massage and yoga classes (remarkably, the latter were free) in a beautiful spa/studio on the hotel's top floor. Our four-day visit was wonderfully restful. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Exceptional stay at the Vitale

likes.liked: — Location, room appointments and cleanliness, service, food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: most amazing hotel such a comfy bed, spa wonderful and the hotel team very helpful.
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.text: My only complaint would be the americano restaurant, thinks it is better than it is, ok it is upmarket but linked to this quality is a standoffishness and coldness of character. Remember to join the joie de vivre club before checking in. My partner is a member but because i was paying they would not give me the points. a bit unfair.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.text: go to the baghdad cafe in the castro if you want real food.
reviews.title: Great hotel, wonderful atmosphere

reviews.text: Oddly, this hotel pulls off a curious mixture of new age, feng shui and modern Danish. The hotel manages to incorporate minimalism with maximum comfort (the beds were fantastic). Early morning yoga classes and flat screen TV’s in the elevator with nature images (and earth music) enforced this unique experience. We stayed on the second floor and had to strain to hear any street noise. We loved the rooftop garden, which encompasses several floors connected by stairs and was great exploring with a three and a half year old. We played I-Spy from the rooftop while picking points along the Embarcadero….what a view! The staff was wonderful and the location ideal. There was easy access to all public transportation. You can catch a cable car to China Town within a five minute walk; street cars and the Muni are even closer. Yank Sing, possibly the best dim sum restaurant in San Francisco, is across the street in the Rincon Center. The Ferry building, across the street on the Embarcadero, sells three day Muni passes (a great deal for $18.00, especially if you plan to explore!). These passes are good for street cars, cable cars and the Muni, but you will need to purchase your BART tickets separately. We visit San Francisco about every 8 months or so and have stayed at the Clift Hotel, Galleria Park Hotel and the Argent. From now on, this will be my first pick.
reviews.title: Feng Shui meets modern Danish
Fabulous
reviews.text: Sophisticated and modern hotel - had a very comfortable stay and staff were very polite and helpful. Loved everything about the room - the comfy bed, plasma TV, towels, seating/lounge area. And tiny touches like the ambient music playing when I entered the room, and the Fresh toilettries provided. Great location. Highly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note: I had a corporate rate of $220 so this was good value.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to celebrate.

likes.liked: — Location, view, beautiful decorations, linens, very plush, room amenities
likes.disliked: — The staff in the restaurant in the hotel was not friendly or attentive.

reviews.title: Pampered but paid for it
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Vitale for my sweetie's birthday. We had a deluxe water view room the first night, and moved to one of the circular suites the next. Both rooms were beautiful and comfortable (and surprisingly quiet considering they overlook the Embarcadero) with great views and lots of amenities. When making the reservation, I mentioned to the hotel that this was a very special birthday celebration. They delivered free of charge, a bottle of champagne, plus a small Scharfenberger cake and birthday card to our room both nights. What a nice surprise! The staff was very friendly, attentive, and responsive. Pricey, yes, but for those special occasions, well worth it when compared with other high end places in SF. We felt very pampered and well taken care of. The only complaint I have is about the service at the Americano cafe in the hotel. We went there for breakfast and the food was very good, but service was slow and indifferent - a big change from the hotel staff. We decided not to go back since there are so many great restaurants in walking distance from the hotel. We had a great time at the Vitale and will definitely go back next time we have a special occasion to celebrate.
The location of the Vitale and the quality of service was excellent. While the staff was young, they were helpful, energetic and plentiful.
reviews.title: Looking forward to our next stay at Hotel Vitale

reviews.text: What a place. Its trendy and hip, even for forty somethings with a teenager in tow. Some confusion about the room, not the hotels fault, we were offered free drinks, and two free breakfasts in compensation. Great location, just off the Embarcadero. 30 mins walk to Fisherman's Wharf, if you can't catch a streetcar.
reviews.title: Ab Fab

likes.disliked: — The noise from the downstairs bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommend Boulevard restaurant across the road, but not cheap
reviews.title: Great Hotel, be careful about the location of your room

reviews.text: We recently stayed at Hotel Vitale over July 4th. Fabulous hotel, new, hip, chic....Very similar in feel to a "W Hotel," only nicer. If you are looking for a mid priced hotel looking at the bay and near the Ferry Building, look no farther. The only negative I would warn travelers about is the noise potential based on the location of your room. The front desk pushed what they call their "Bay View" rooms, but what they don't tell you is that some are directly over their outdoor restaurant and bar. The night we were there turned out to be extremely busy for the outdoor bar, and the noise was almost unbearable. Even the "noise machine" located by the bed couldn't drown out the noise. Upon checkout the front desk said their partial "bay view" rooms and city view rooms were the most quiet. If you do choose to opt for the full bay view, I would recommend you stay on floor 5 or higher.
reviews.title: Hip, Well Located, Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Vitale for three nights for my husband's birthday. I noted the occasion when making the online reservation and we were greeted with a bottle of champagne, chocolate cake and a handwritten birthday note in our room when we arrived. The room offered a beautiful view of the bay bridge. The design of the hotel and rooms is clean, soft and modern with high quality furnishings, Fresh bath products, flat screen TV, etc. The service was exceptional. The location was excellent. One of the best hotel experiences we've ever had.
reviews.title: Hotel Vitale is Fabulous

likes.liked: — Exceptional design of hotel and rooms; thoughtful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I live in SoCal now, I am a NorCal native and long-time resident. My partner and I decided to stay in the city for her birthday, and I wanted to find a hotel that wasn't the standard cookie-cutter major-chain type (although I am a rewards member of many). I don't even remember how I landed on the Hotel Vitale site, but I was instantly hooked. Reason: The Ferry Building. If you are a foodie, you KNOW already you're going to SF, you KNOW where you want to be on a Saturday morning, and this hotel is right across the street, poised in perfect striking distance. So I browsed the site, and was amazed that this little hidden gem was to be found. I booked one of the better rooms with a TERRIFIC view (room 606) and spa shower, and took the plunge with an open mind and high hopes.
reviews.title: Hotel Vitale is a winner!!!

likes.liked: — Location, close to all public transport modes, quiet, luxurious

reviews.text: The Hotel Vitale did not disappoint. From the moment we got there, the modern elegance of the property was wonderful. My partner was a little recalcitrant at first (as she put it, she could not think of a hotel that, on first sight, was LESS "her type") but when we got to the room...
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Bachelorette Party!

likes.liked: — The beds with the amazing linens and duvet covers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had advised the hotel that it was my partner's birthday. When we got in (very late Fri night), there awaited a bottle of champagne on ice...and not Cook's or something cheap, either! It was a very impressive bottle of Chandon Brut. accompanied by a personalized card for me from the manager, as well as a personalized card for my partner (from the housekeeping staff at turndown).
reviews.title: Very Good Experience

likes.disliked: — No dresser with drawers for storage of clothes.

reviews.text: We were worried about the minbar, because we intended to purchase food at the farmer's market/Ferry Building on Sat, and nosh on it throughout the weekend. Not to worry -- the minibar was NOT one of those electronic-sensor ones that charges your room if you just breathe on something...we were able to remove items to make room for our purchases, and then replace them when we were done. Housekeeping seemed to dig this immediately, as nothing was moved or touched in that regard.
reviews.title: Form and Function and function loses

reviews.text: Hotel Vitale is a great choice for exploring SF. Ferries are accross the street and take you to as far as Sausalito. Rooms are well kept and clean. We were there for my wife's birthday and they upgraded us to a room with a very nice view on the very top floor. Embarcadero station is a 5 minute walk and can take you just about anywhere in town. We stayed as part of a package from expedia and got a great rate for what we got. We will not hesitate staying here again.
reviews.title: Great location, upscale chic!

reviews.text: I booked a lengthy stay and requested a quiet room. Before I arrived I confirmed that I was getting a quiet room (I'd even agreed to downgrade from what I had purchased to get a courtyard room.) On arrival, I should have known something was wrong when I saw a large "white noise" machine next to the bed. Every ten minutes or so, the room would rattle and there would be a grinding sound. This went on all night. After 2 sleepless nights, I complained. The management said I could move but that "check in is at 3pm". They knew the problem right away--the room was next to electrical equipment and the elevator. They knew exactly what they were doing when they put me there. I have to think it was because I purchased through Expedia, because when I confirmed the reservation they said "Oh, I see you used Expedia." Anyway, most of the rooms abut the Embarcadero, which is a six lane highway. This is not a quiet hotel. The room service is limited and expensive. A simple order of a 16 oz. container of coffee is $19--after mandatory tip, service charges and tax. There is almost no storage space--no drawers for clothing, just some hanging space. The neighborhood is the financial district, which is dead on the weekend. I've stayed in SF dozens of times, and thought I'd try something different. Never again--why play Russian Roulette with your vacation.
reviews.title: Russian Roulette

reviews.text: Some friends and I stayed at the Hotel Vitale for one night in July. This was my second stay there.
reviews.title: Great hotel, a little pricey
Relaxing Stay at the Hotel Vitale
reviews.text: One downside of the Vitale is that it's pricey. Even the parking is more than other hotels in town. While my room the first time had a great view of the Ferry Building and Bay Bridge, the second time my (cheaper) room looked out onto an air shaft. The sliding doors for the bathroom don't offer much privacy if you're staying with someone else. Also, someone messed up and made our spa reservations for the wrong day (fortunately, the spa was able to accomodate us only an hour later than we'd planned).

reviews.title: Elegance with friendly staff
reviews.text: On the upside, the location is fabulous. The Ferry Building is across the street--we bought breakfast there and then ate it on the hotel's wonderful little 5th floor terrace. BART and MUNI are also very convenient, and sights such as Union Square are an easy walk away. The decor is nice, and the whole place smells faintly like aromatherapy. It definitely doesn't have that bland look so many chain hotels have. The staff was unfailingly helpful and pleasant. On this visit we were able to get early check in at 11, and late check out at 2. The beds are really comfy and the turndown service is nice. The rooms are quiet and reasonably large. The toileteries are Fresh brand--very nice.
While planning a quick two night trip to SF I was impressed with the Hotel Vitale's web sight and after talking to a friend who lives in the Bay area, I decided to book a room.
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Vitale

likes.disliked: — Valet parking is a little pricey

reviews.text: I was not disappointed one time during my stay...I found the staff professioinal and courteous. Had a great room on the 8th floor over looking the bridge. The room was comfortable yet stylish .....recently some of the hotel rooms have taken on an almost cookie cutter appearance....all the W's, Ritz etc. have the same general appearance regardless of the city. This was not the case at the Vitale.
reviews.title: Best hotel in San Francisco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previously I have stayed at the Campton and the Clift among others....although they were not an unpleasant experience, there was also nothing memorable about them. Enjoyed the energy of the hotel and will be going back soon.
reviews.title: Perfect stay for our 5 year anniversary
Best Hotel in the USA
reviews.text: We booked the hotel primarily for it's location across from the Ferry Building so we could roll out of bed, go for a run then SHOP the Saturday farmers' market. Also right across the street from a great restaurant, Boulevard. It turned out to be the best hotel (out of about 30) that I have stayed at ever in SF. Beautiful room with a view of the Bay Bridge lights at night and the boats on the bay. Whisper quiet room on the 7th floor (very rare in SF). Excellent friendly staff. Reasonably priced 1 hour massage. Will be back over and over.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spend the extra $100 for a bay view room, well worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely, but possibly overrated?

likes.disliked: — Noisy, a little too hip for this middle aged women.

reviews.text: I travel to San Francisco a great deal. Since I discovered the Vitale I have stayed here almost every week on business exclusively for almost a year and love every bit of my stay. This place is unbeatable. Comfort is superb, magnificent view, uber friendly staff - Very very clean, very comfortable bed, quiet. Hotel opened in 2005 - soon it will be difficult to get a room. And the Americano restaurant - wow! I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret in San Francisco

reviews.text: The Hotel Vitale is overrated in my opinion. It's lacking in some very nice touches such as an array of toilet items (free), papers left by the door and free coffee in the room.
reviews.title: Vitale is overrated - needs a little more value. . .
Great hotel, echo all positive reviews
reviews.text: The operative word here is "free". The Vitale is set up to encourage you to spend more money. The room's array of treats - chocolates, etc. are in full view to entice you into eating and buying. Bath items for sale are displayed in the bathroom.

reviews.title: No On Site Parking, Terrible Management
reviews.text: This hotel has no parking whatsoever. If you come with your own or with a rented car, be prepared for long waits and an indifferent staff. Parking has been subcontracted out to a valet service that parks your car blocks away from the hotel. Be prepared to wait 20 or 30 minutes for the return of your car, even if you call in advance.

reviews.title: I didn't enjoy myself
reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions and this problem has been persistant. As such, I've stopped staying at Vitale and have returned to the W Hotel (nearby at 3rd and Howard). However, I returned to Vitale recently for dinner. What a mistake. After yet another unpleasant experience with the valet parking staff, I attempted to discuss the issue with management (I foolishly thought the hotel would like to know why a previously loyal guest had stopped staying with them). Unfortunately, I found the night manager I spoke with to be rude, argumentative and indifferent.

reviews.title: Falls Down on the Little Things
reviews.text: This hotel needs to carefully examine its parking scheme. Further, it should endeavor to be genuinely understanding of guests and customers who feel inconvenienced by its lack of parking and the long waits at its valet.
Competant management would be a great place to start on that account.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but far from shopping

reviews.text: This hotel is new, but lacks service an style. I wasn't welcomed at the curb nor was I granted an amenity as they promised when I signed-up for the JDV loyalty program.
reviews.title: Retro fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best experiences I have had with a hotel. The attention to detail was fantastic!! I don't think there is a bad room in the place!! The staff was accomodating and pleasant. The decore is wonderful and the linens are so comfortable. I wonderful place to stay!
reviews.title: A Slice of Heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was brilliant - really was an excellent 4 star. The location was perfect to get around san fran, the views of the bay were excellent, and the general atmosphere in the hotel was so relaxing. Highly recommend this hotel when in san fran - we'll be staying there again!
reviews.title: AMAZING!!

reviews.text: I wanted to get out of the snow, and had always wanted to visit The Hotel Vitale and it was just wonderful! The staff was more than accommodating and super friendly! I had lunch in the Americano, and it was also great. Then off to a rooftop bath treatment, followed by a massage, all fantastic! The room was spectacular, it was the panoramic suite on the 5th floor. I adored the attention to detail. It was simply a treat, I would go back again and again.
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVED IT!!!

reviews.text: Not in the tourist district, & location is wonderful. Embarcadero is fun & pretty, lots of lunch options at Ferry Plaza, water water everywhere. People around all the time. Farmers Market @ Ferry on weekends. About 3/4 mile to the convention center. 1 mile of a lovely promenade walk to the Wharf. FABulous views of Bay Bridge from the street front rooms (odd #s). You can take the BART from the airport to the Embarcadero stop -- 2 blocks walk!
reviews.title: Kinda glam, cool, some (unwarranted) attitude
Wonderful City Hotel
reviews.text: Was thrilled to see reception & my room after the trek out from the East Coast. The rainshower was refreshing & relaxing. Amenities were lovely & generous (+ others available for purchase), bed extremely comfortable, excellent robes & slippers. No street noise, despite being on the third floor above a very busy street. The little terrace on the 7th floor was excellent for a rose champagne & wonderful cheese from across the street. Very attentive housekeeping, knew my exact preferences after 1st day.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: Cons: very small gym (& NOISY machines, try not to get one of those rooms nearby!); oddly limited room service menu from a restaurant with very extensive menu (I tried to order to take up instead. Odd reaction. When the food did come, asked staff for silverware, explained I was a guest - so they didn't think I was stealing forks. They almost didn't let me out of the restaurant! They said it was "policy" - stated no where - because room service "is supposed to be exclusive." After explaning not being intrigued by anything on the room menu, being really tired and promising NOT to do this again, they let me take my dinner); lighting in the closet area is very limited (forgive me, maybe some tap lights?); reception desk VERY efficient but not welcoming (compared to a sleek W hotel, where staff is as efficient + outstandingly friendly); if you're a TV person, location of the flat screen is akward - odd angel from bed & RIGHT above the work station (couldn't have on for a noise distriction as it's right in your face).

I would return, this was a unique experience in a not-too-touristy area. The bar at the restaurant was hopping, & had an excellent $6 glass of pinot grigio. Now that I know "the rules," perhaps that won't cloud my impression.
reviews.title: For the Price, I Expected Better
